The issue in the given code snippet is that it lacks a proper label for the select element, which is important for accessibility. To fix this issue, we can add a label element with a "for" attribute that matches the "id" attribute of the select element. Here's the correct version of the code snippet:

```
<label for="selectElement">Select an option:</label>
<select name="..." id="selectElement">
  <!-- Options go here -->
</select>
```

By adding the label element, we've provided an accessible name for the select element, making it more accessible for users who rely on screen readers and other assistive technologies.
